i2oDxTWURRH6-SmkiTWX5Q.text: Went to this restaurant yesterday, having been there 2 years ago and was really disappointed. We arrived at about 2.30 p.m. to find it was extremely busy but was assured a table was just about to be vacated and we could have it once it had been cleaned and laid for us. Then the Manageress advised that waitress that people had been waiting outside and they had first dibs on that table. So we were offered the window seats with high stools (extremely uncomfortable) and not very practical for the three of us to share our intended starter!!!! We're really like the edamame there and ordered this for the three of us to share and at the same time asked if we could move to a proper table when one became available. We also ordered main dishes for each of us. Having sat at the table a different waiter brought us our main dishes and I told him we'd asked for the edamame first and he just went away without looking into it so we assumed he was going to go and bring it to us. A while later we enquired of our orignal waitress about the edamame to be told Jesus, I forgot to order it! Would you like me to order it for you? Well, frankly by that time it was getting late and we needed to get to Euston to catch a train home, so declined, but there was no apology at her oversight. We tried to ask for our bill but the Manageress, with a vacant look on her face, only seemed to be aware of people coming in through the door and walked back and forth between the till and the door totally ignoring us trying to catch her attention. We love the Giraffe food but I guarantee we'll not be returning to this branch as it's plain their customer service leaves much to be desired.

4rTOv5t8HgW9I9mDn3aGtg.text: There are now numerous Giraffes all over the city, but I think the brunswick was one of the early ones. My friends with kids love this place, they take them there for brunch practically every week. I have to admit it is a very family friendly restaurant, with booths at the back, activity sheets and crayons. Enough to keep them occupied until the food arrives. The menu is also child orientated, with kids meals as well as lots of burgers and dishes that come with fries. It is therefore also a good place to take friends who are not hugely adventurous, as most of the food is not too spicy or exotic. Everything is tasty enough, but sometimes it is not cooked fantastically well, being either over or under done. I used to like the Giraffe in Spitalfields a lot, so I wonder whether it is just menu fatigue brought on by the fact that the place has become such a large chain.

Xr2Wz_OAw9hiU9Y3scyAsQ.text: I happened to notice that this restaurant had a great offer for a dinner and talked my friend over to meet me there after work. The location in the Brunswick square is nice and quiet and hidden from cars and the restaurant named Giraffe with a orange decoration seemed friendly to say the least!The deal was for a starter and main £7.95 and after the drinks were also two in the price of one, we were very happy. For a starter I had deep fried shrimps and for main a creek salad. The portion with the shrimps was really small, tasteless and created without absolutely any imagination. However the main dishes were huge and I have to give the salad credit for being fresh, but again a bit tasteless and you know, just the basic stuff.It was a fair deal for us but I don't think I would visit the place with full prices - even though it is not even that that expensive, but just knowing that with that money you can get better deal from elsewhere. Sorry Giraffe.

sHhhhogHP-OEFRv5D372pQ.text: I ate here late with my mother, and it was really nice. As we commented at the time, this was one of the few places open at that time on a saturday night for people in that area, so they didn't really have much choice, but even so, they were enjoying the experience, and frankly so did we. The venue doesn't offer the draught Red Stripe option but to be fair the menu says that not every venue does, so I had a glass of diet Coke and my mother had an apple juice. She opted for the half chicken, which was too much for her, and I had the Hot Thai Duck stir fry, which was delicious, with a side order of potato wedges. The prices were very reasonable and the food was much better than the muck we had at the British Library. Would have had a dessert too but the wedges plugged that hole.

RhPuOEZFwmmtshmHRalHxA.text: A pretty good restaurant in Brunswick Center. Serves mainly simple, but generally high quality dishes such as burgers and salads, as well as some oriental meals. The staff are nice and the setting is fairly pleasant. In my view, certainly a good alternative to the nearby Hare & Tortoise if you want to talk and listen as well as eat, as this place isn't usually very congested or noisy. Definitely a decent option for lunch in the Bloomsbury area.

zO-ofl2VtEsC8tGO1yBC_w.text: The Giraffe chain is known for its interesting but tasty dishes and exuberant decor. This one opened in the Brunswick Centre over a year ago and serves the usual ciabattas and nachos for snacks as well as main meals. The prices are ok, though there are nicer places nearby When I last went we were disappointed, however, that the chicken burger was served cold - we were told it was meant to be so, but we would rather have been forewarned!

WPyJolaJpMdWSw4K_tI3og.text: This is a lovely branch of Giraffe and the staff are fantastic, they fall over themselves to help you. The food is really good, and although slightly expensive it's definitely worth it. They are very child friendly and always give out balloons/crayons to little ones which is a really nice touch.

2DnEPAu9S2H_NF5yK2SKJQ.text: I hate chain restaurants, but I have a great weakness for Giraffe. I like their Mezze plates. I love their multicultural menu, especially their Butternut Squash Curry (although their burgers are very good, too.) I love their Lime Mango Daiquiri's. I love their pudding, the apple berry crumble, the banoffee pies, the swiss mountain chocolate cheesecake. I even love their logo, and how sleek and smart that orange giraffe silhouette looks on the staff uniforms. And if you have kids, get them a "Giddy Giraffe" smoothie, because it comes with a plastic giraffe stir stick that HAS LEGS. How awesome is that?

X5UQWfJRDy1Pgfakuqk9mQ.text: it presents food from around the globe.i guess the founders were very cultivated people!but i like the vibe here.this is the one of many of the giraffe restaurants ive been too.however the downfall of the bloomsbury branch is that the manager is an absolutely monstrosity!the atmosphere was fun and warmly but he made it less fun and was abit patronising. he actually had the ordasity to shift a few of the chairs that me and my friends were sitting on with his feet and told us that we were obstructing everyone else's way of walking (only to specify that he was only talking about himself).and then he told us to quieten down after as if we were kids,bearing in mind we are 25 +!i dont think i like to go back to this one tbh but its a shame because the area is delightful.anyways on a good note their cocktails are bloody tasty,try the passion fruit margarita..oh and i was petrified that i wouldn't be able to finish a whole pizza to myself but i did .it was thin crust mind so it wasn't too filling..i think the toppings were roasted mushrooms,goats cheese with spinach,rocket,pesto and onion.the food and drink are worth the try but the customer service was absurd!

UGFdUKWAWxEQvQz-HQg18Q.text: LOVED it! There are a lot of different things on the menu so they have something for just about everyone. When i was visiting my friend in London we ate here almost every night. The brownie desert with ice cream was DELICIOUS. the restaurant itself has a very nice atmosphere and doesn't feel too crowded, even if you're sitting right next to someone. We ate breakfast here a few times too, It was very good. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

3e-BtUsF-2pE28OZVZQxtA.text: Gorgeous porridge, gorgeous bacon sandwich and lovely bright location. Staff could perhaps be a little more attentive, but I really wish Giraffe would come to Edinburgh! Set in the very nice shopping centre just across from Russell Square tube so a stepping off point for a quick out of the centre browse or a food raid on Waitrose. And they have wifi.....

yzY0CqOm_O-vcGyvOfrLFg.text: Living in the International Hall down the street for a semester, friends and I ate here plenty. The food was always great, no matter the time of day. They had a special going for lunch that included a drink and a dessert, along with the entree and fries, for I think around 6 pounds. My favorite was the breakfast, though, delicious and very well priced. I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the staff was always friendly and helpful. They also seem more than accommodating: there was one day where friends and I were there, not sure if anyone else would join us. The waitress went ahead and took our orders, etc. A few of our classmates showed up, and she was quick to pull up chairs and make room for them, and get them served asap. It was nice!

2EKPehg7qCpAj6D7AwssMg.text: The husband is out of town, the babysitter is out of town, and so I am stuck exploring the gastronomic stylings of two young children until Saturday. Help! I've been cooking at home for a couple of days now, and I needed to get out. After watching the kids playing for a while at Coram's Fields, the siren song of Giraffe was too strong, and I decided to check it out.I had been advised/warned about Giraffe before moving to London. My friends with kids said that the food wasn't too bad, and that the children would love it, but not to expect too much. Nonetheless, when I saw that they had Huevos Rancheros on the menu, my Tex-Mex longing went through the "have some sense!" meter, and I ordered that for myself. The kids, unshockingly, ordered the crispy chicken strips. (I'm actually selling the kids too short here - they do like a range of food, but everyone opts for comfort food sometime.)In addition to the chips and chicken, the children's dishes also came with some corn, adding a bit of nutritional value, which was nice. Meanwhile, my huevos had, what? what is that? pepperoni? WHAT? (It was actually chorizo, but still.) Rather than rolled on the side, for maximum customization of every bite, the tortilla was splayed flat, with cheese, beans, eggs, and meat on top. If I had ordered the eggs fried rather than scrambled, it would have been very similar to an Florence-style pizza, in fact. Lesson learned - no more Tex-Mex style food at Giraffe for me.That said, as long as I pretended I wasn't eating huevos rancheros, the flavor wasn't that bad, and the ingredients were clearly fresh. They also had tabasco on the table to spice things up a bit. The children loved their food, crayons, plastic giraffes, etc. The service was fast and super-friendly, and the prices were reasonable. For a treat (or a bribe) for the kids in the future, I would probably go here again.

a1kOD4DbKKpuHMrqf7J_mg.text: Poor service, gross waiters, gross food. Waiter was sick, food was nasty, HORRIBLE SERVIXE

b-eooDseYG72mlOQ_whI1A.text: This place was great. Burgers and onion rings were excellent. Staff was excellent. A burger joint away from home (California), kept me from getting homesick. I recommend this place for families or travelers who don't know where to eat in London.

0GU91IU_5TuD26e9-cY25Q.text: From the first sight of Giraffe I fall in love with the  concept of the place. And have been trying since then to enjoy the food as much as the atmosphere . But to be honest, the food failed to make me feel so .. it is hardly average. The only thing that make them a 3 stars spot for me is the 'stacked pancakes' (the only American style pancake I found in London) for breakfast, plus they have a very good latte to start your day with. Lunch and dinner is not their thing though, except their beef burger which is is quite good too.  Oh yeah.. and I like their choices of music .. it's really cool and very funky and international (and you can buy the CDs if you like them) .. so enjoy!

GnrG1Ma6fgOO1u3lBMIiVw.text: Giraffe can be terrific and really sate cravings for an umami burst. Edamame, East Asian inflected dishes, etc. are generally pretty good, but tend to be very salty/soy-ey. My American children think the burgers are very good. The menu changes fairly regularly and both the flavorless and the flavorful go their way every few months. If you want a salad that has a lot of interesting bits in it, Giraffe usually offers up something tasty. But every once in a while I'll order something and it is just dull and missing a key flavor or texture. Fish and meat can be overdone, too. Service is generally very nice and the prices are good for central London, but sometimes I feel like I would have done better with something from Waitrose warmed up at home....

uA84cZ4xd1LvIYAuwBiqPg.text: I like this place. I'm not completely blown away by it, but here's what I like:decent food, not fantastic, but the greek lamb burger is pretty good (although the burger is a tad overcooked to my liking), and the barbecue chicken quesadilla is also decent (the chipotle aioli is good, the salsa is interesting with a hint of masala or something, but the bbq chicken is pretty bland).I love the free wi-fi, and if you sit by the corner not too far from the looks, you'll find a table with access to 2 sockets, great for those long work sessions.I'll come back here, as the music is really nice (world music), and the coffee is pretty good (especially the espresso noisette!).

Jono22V11dQHGC0Yf-frCw.text: I've eaten at this location a number of times for breakfast and have enjoyed their selection ranging from breakfast sandwiches to porridge to the full English breakfast.  The 4-star is for consistency and service rather than for outstanding flavor but it's nice to just have regular food for breakfast.

7nzq0SSYJiM3YKoHtFFLbw.text: Have been here about 3 or 4 times, I think, and the food is always pretty good. Breakfast in particular is decent - nice stack of blueberry pancakes, and their website is great as well and has pretty much everything you'd need to know on it, so well worth taking a look at the menu before you go. The staff, however, are terrible. They're amongst the least attentive I've experienced actually, so you'll always be waiting about 20 minutes to pay the bill if it's busy, and even if it's not you'll practically have to grab someone by the arm and frogmarch them to the till in order to leave the place. Went there a couple of days ago and the woman serving us came to take our order, but then realised she didn't have a pad and got so distracted en route that she never returned. Spooky.

DmRPygQW59oyXK4UKoSNLQ.text: Giraffe is a cute concept that, at least at this location, doesn't entirely meet its potential.  I've eaten twice at this location, and both times been sort of blah about the experience.   The burger was pretty average on the first visit, and the pizza was better than average on the 2nd.  The wait staff are a little overly casual at times.  One waiter pulled up a chair and hung out with us for awhile when it came time for us to order, and was perhaps overly flirtatious with my friend.  But friendly is better than rude, so I can't spend too much time complaning.I do love the location, though.  Right off of Russell Square in the Brunswick Center which is always hopping when the weather is good, lots of students and eye candy milling about which gives the place a fun fresh feeling.   I like that the restaurant has outdoor seating and always makes and effort to keep the doors open for a fabulous cross-breeze to come through.  Not bad, maybe a little underwhelming for the price.

77IlRgfUUcyze2iSN0dLlA.text: When we first got off the train to London, it was super early and I yelped to find a place that had some cheap breakfast.  Giraffe didn't disappoint.  It was rather early in the morning so we were like the only people there, but my breakfast quesadilla was very yummy.  And I loved the little giraffe touches.  I think it's not a bad place to stop in for a delicious breakfast!

67qrcnkzczIOhnJlvit00g.text: Underwhelmed on the whole. Burger and chips very pricey given that it's a chain made thing. Very small portion of chips.I guess I was unlucky with the staff, humourless and dry. Ah well. Go to Nando's just down the way if you're just looking to go for a bite somewhere.

AOmO1eibClKH6tI-DHWDeA.text: Me and my partner stopped by The Giraffe whilst waiting to see 'Wicked' at the Apollo. the restaurant was close by and had a friendly attractive atmosphere. we only had a small brunch meal but it was reasonably priced and our food arrived quite quickly despite their being a rush of people. the food was delicious and the staff was friendly, I would definitely recommend it!

BL11NUdqEe7nsPi4t5u10g.text: This place is quite difficult to categorise: african, mexican, asian? who knows!? Anyways, the food was nice and well priced. Lookout for really good value deals/offers during the week. Service was average.

PxKE8UNCLRaSPeJRFJK35w.text: Giraffe is pretty much a chain restaurant, where I say pretty much because they seem to try to vary their menu a bit between nearby outlets. The food served is what they call world food, where you'll find food of many different cultures, e.g. burgers, tortillas, phod malay udon noodles, thai duck stir fry, and etc. I happen to like their Vietnamese prawn and chicken curry. Food is quite pricey for only average-sized portions, but they aren't too bad, though nothing special. But if you come during non-peak hours, 5-7pm, you'll get 50% of some of their cocktails, beers and wines. I'm not sure if this applies to their other branches though. Service is average.

k1JwUaf1yt649FT4_STp0g.text: Wonderful place to have breakfast.  Everchanging menu allows a person to never get bored with what the place has to offer.

mLNOiw0eiYHo10FHdQpetw.text: The manager woman is very friendly.  We always come in with large groups (6 or more) and she happily takes over our table on behalf of her not-as-nice staffers.  The food is to die for, the prices are reasonable.  Go for breakfast!  Great atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Banana and Blueberry pancakes.
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Brekkie Bap
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

pllozsv6ZjdLtTE4D5jZag.text: Have to say this place is one of the restaurants I frequented while abroad. The service was great and the atmosphere was charming and welcoming. The music was funky and mod, almost as if I was dining in a swanky club. The food was great and actually had spice to it, and I enjoyed the burger, the breakfast menu, and their deserts are well done. The location in Russell Square is great as well, and is surrounded by other sites to see. On the plus side, there is a tube station across the street.

YRyc_c0dApHUoKNQhB4mhg.text: Very beautiful place, although there may be too many tables. Giraffe hamburhuer was delicious with a very quality meat!Price very affordable

lgsc5-Wi_RZ_w1XHgwyO2w.text: Started my meal with the steamed duck bao buns. Great taste on delicious fluffy buns. Moved on to the jerk ribs for my entree and added the topped fries. I'm not sure that it was really jerk sauce... but I did enjoy them. The fries were okay-- the meat on them could have used a little more flavor and salt. Everything that my friends ordered sucked so... good luck, lol. Sorry I don't remember what they ordered or else I'd warn ya not to get it.It was so crowded that service wasn't the quickest; wasn't awful though.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Topped Fries
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Jerk Ribs
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Duck Bao Buns

Hl_SrY_q_DhGToKbsUh3JQ.text: This place used to be really great - fast eclectic food, good prices. No longer. The food was still great - an hour after we ordered it. We and three other tables have been trying to get our check for a solid 30 min with no success. The waiter says "I don't even know where my head is." We know. It's a Monday night and there are maybe another 6 tables dining for 3 waitstaff. There's just no reason. It's depressing. My opinion of this place just plummeted.

_IeyELyMNtsLRYfDdz5y7g.text: Late Sunday nights there are not a lot of places open, period.  I decided to give this place a try because there were a fair number of people in the restaurant. I ordered the steak, and I was disappointed because the piece of meat was tough, full of tendons, and not flavorful at all.  The side salad was lackluster at best as well, generally way better ways to spend your hard earned money.

DUaLgWFzahy4P24_d0Mjzw.text: I went to this restaurant on a Tuesday evening and got the half-price burger! My friend finished all the food but I left some in the plate. The amount is huge!

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

FtXOnpo9n_tx4N07DZvElw.text: I liked their chicken burger. Loved their half off Tuesday deals. The day we went was national pancake day so half off of that too. My friend got that. Overall lovely experience.

mbLHsfM9UvCXiNWph52FWA.text: On a warm summer day asked to seated outside under the umbrella. And then we waited for 15 minutes with no service whatsoever  we took our menus and went and asked for a table inside. No apology or explanation. Ordered the tapas plates which while tasty were warm to cool. Service was slow even compared to other diners. The next morning I regretted the meal again.

dw8enRqQhgQ_bIIJGD82ug.text: Food is quite nice and unique from the other chain stores, I got the lamb which tasted amazing, we also got a salad along with a chicken roll, I found that the food was nice, the service was okay and it wasn't busy for lunch, didn't love it nor hated it

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Chicken roll with chicken
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Salad
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Lamb

J0DVgryH2e41BjrI7F4y7g.text: I've been to a few Giraffe restaurants before, but usually for lunch or dinner. When my husband (then boyfriend) came to visit me in the UK ended up taking refuge from the harsh winter weather and stopping for a coffee and some breakfast. The coffee was alright, I think once you've had real American drip coffee at even the most run-down establishments you come to realise how weak the UK version is in comparison. But it was coffee, and it warmed us well! He ordered a breakfast burrito, and a side of bacon to curb his hunger, and I stuck with poached eggs, bacon and a round of toast. It was definitely a little on the expensive side for the portion sizes, but it was cooked as well as it could be. It was nothing to write home about, but it filled a hole and we were very grateful for that! The service was pretty poor though, especially as the restaurant was nearly empty, which has been what's brought the overall rating down.It was a shame really as I'd vouched for Giraffe based on some of the tasty Mexican dishes I'd had the pleasure to have previously.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Coffees, breakfast burritos, eggs, bacon, and a round of toast.

aQ2DgXgdhk6ngxWIWBf0KA.text: Great quick breakfast before catching train.I came here prior to jumping on a train up to Hull.  I had the English Breakfast and loved it.  The clerk at the counter was upbeat and funny.  The rest of the staff was equally upbeat and smiling:  busser, food runner, etc.Don't half step.  Grab a spot at the common table and enjoy a quick breakfast before jumping on the train or hitting the city.

Bcaoj-6dZeSau7uD0Z6uiA.text: Faux-hip corporate ambience. All the spirit and soul that we know real hipsterism has, but reheated in a food warmer.   The Huevos Rancheros was essentially a pancake with some tins of things opened and dumped on it.  It was hardly even heated up, and bore no sign of any culinary skill having been used in its preparation, or indeed anywhere in its vicinity.Staff didn't care too much; I don't think anyone here breaks a sweat.  A sentiment I'll reciprocate by not coming back. I am sure the business plan for these places is fine-tuned for profit maximisation in that interval between opening, rollout and the day about two years later when everyone realises the whole thing is a pile o' poo. Tesco has reached that moment. They have sold Giraffe and say their in-store cafes will now meet the need for in-store dining.  That statement -from the horse's mouth - tells you what you're really getting at a Giraffe.

wjXfGxlV1IgrWX2ubzCXVg.text: Went in on a whim, was not disappointed. The calamari and Scampi pasta was delicious.

tiTYFTEWcvCveDg1N5Q1hg.text: The brunch is a typical English breakfast, quite tasty and with good quality. Staff are really nice and the environment is quite calming if you do not go at the busy times. It's worth trying once at least

fdSBB6kdK_UL0xGZuewtCA.text: I'm still not quite sure what to make of Giraffe.  I find it's a bit of strange place that can't quite identify what it is, cafe/restaurant/bar.  Depending which of the venues you visit will depend on what it most resembles.  My favourite thing about Giraffe has to be the bar buddies, at 50% off selected drinks Sunday-Friday in the evenings.  They have a good selection of cocktails, beer and wine to choose from. The food however I'm still unsure of, the portions are small and it isn't cheap and they seem to sell a selection of different foods. Their offers are probably the best value for money with Burger night on a Tuesday and feel good menu for £9.95, although the selections are limited.

xA8X0Ptp25TV7xfiClXmFg.text: I came here for lunch alone. I had an OK table and was greeted promptly - the service was really wonderful here. My waiter was really attentive, friendly, and funny, and the rest of the staff was attentive and on top of it with everyone who walked in the door. I had a salmon dish which wasn't bad - good chips, probably the best I had in the city (not those frozen chips!). The salmon was cooked well and had a tasty tomato and corn salsa on top of it. I also had a glass of mediocre Chilean white wine. I had a bit of work to do and used the free wifi from the Starbucks. The staff was non-pressuring and let me linger a bit while I finished my wine. I probably wouldn't rush back to Giraffe, or any of the other locations. The main reason is that it's quite a popular place for families - I was one of the few people without a kid in tow. So, if you have kids...you might like this place a bit more than I! It's very kid friendly.

wbfxbjExbyxElt_9p1u_BA.text: Overall the food was good but service seemed a little slow. We started with the world bread appetizer, something that we thought was easy but took a while to come out. When we got it though it was delicious. I also had the bowl for the soul. It had a good flavor but I added shrimp to it and only found a handful which did not seem to reflect the price addition. The ginger and honey ice cream as well as the vanilla were both a refreshing way to end the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Bowl for the soul with shrimp

J-QXmmikBsXxDIPaWDWszg.text: We went to Brunswick centre and they were totally full but we found a table outside. They were busy but the Spanish waitress made a very good impression and was very patient as we weren't sure about the drinks order quite yet.Once we ordered the food came quite good on time and tasted very good! For starter we had the chicken Popsicles or something like that and they were really good! Once finished it took less then 15 min for the main course to arrive which were burgers! The meat itself tasted good but wasn't that amazing ground so you had sometimes a few harder pieces of meat. Another thing which was not that big deal but a bit annoying-there was a lot of rocket salad on the burger which made the burger taste a little bitter.Overall I can say it's worth a visit. Their menus gigantic and there is definitely something for everyone.

fITHOKVzB6oaIGs4McCumw.text: We decided to pop in for a quick drink as we needed to be somewhere near a waitrose that was on the way to a friends house. So it wasn't a planned trip but I would definitely go back, although the drinks took slightly longer to come out than expected they were surprisingly good for the price (bar buddies ) and all of the staff were friendly and helpful, and let us sit down on an outside table of our choice. I didn't try any food but really enjoyed my mango and lime daiquiri. I am not sure what category giraffe fits into really but if you are looking for a quick, reasonably priced cocktail near to a waitrose this place fits the bill.

pgPmx8EcTNW_NrT0En1u3w.text: For a restaurant chain that has quite a varied menu, the food is pretty good.  The lamb burger was tasty and filling. The brunch looked huge and the sausages were yummy. Service was slick and the prices reasonable. Informal atmosphere makes it good for kids.Relatively speaking the milk shakes are overpriced.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

Im_QRh5TC3lZttYeE-uu6A.text: Cheap fantastic food. Had an awesome breakfast there this morning. They happily accommodated a large group and everyone was very happy with food and service.
